questions.question: Why are young drivers at risk of road accidents?

choices.answer: Lack of driving experience
Overconfidence
Carrying friends as passengers
All of the above

Classed as a depressant, can make someone drunk.
Being over the blood alcohol limit.
A coloured liquid
Blood Alcohol Concentration
Blood Alcohol Content

Blood Alcohol Comparison

Random Blood Test

The capacity to recover quickly from difficulties.
Feelings of contentment.
Controlling a group or individual.
An agreement to do something.

questions.question: Setting ground rules at the start of a new relationship:

choices.answer: Can be harmful to a new relationship.
Can cause a negative relationship for both people.
Can help make it a positive relationship for both people.
Can cause an abusive relationship for both people.
Staying quiet and not saying how you feel.
Clearly and confidently stating your opinion.
Being forceful with opinions and not listening to others.
Respecting others opinions and standing up for yourself.
Violence occurring randomly on the street.
Strength of emotion.
Violent or aggressive behaviour within the home.
Violent behaviour between children.
Teasing, taunting and calling the person names.
Telling a person that they are not worthy of life.
Taking a persons money from them.
Any intentional act causing injury or trauma to the body.
Pushing and shoving another individual.
Physical contact with the body- Eg: bruises, cuts.
Emotional abuse does not leave physical scars.
Taking away a persons independence, confidence/self esteem.
Taking away someones money.
Telling a person that they are useless.
Preventing a person from spending time with family/friends.
Hitting and punching a person.
Sexual activity between two partners that have agreed.
Any form of forced or unwanted sexual activity.
Not allowing another person to visit friends or family.
All of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of a resilient person?

choices.answer: Ability to bounce back.
Confident.
Positive outlook on life.
All of the above.
The understanding that each individual is the same.
The similarities that exist between people.
The understanding that each individual is unique, different.
The similarities between people of a specific culture.
Being fair and sharing equally.
The lack of fairness or justice.
Having justice and rights.
The fairness that exists in society.

questions.question: An example of an Inequity is:

choices.answer: Lower life expectancies for the Aboriginal people.
Loss of rights for the Elderly.
Lack of facilities for people with disabilities.
All of the above.

questions.question: A safe sexual health practice is:

choices.answer: Using a condom when participating in sexual intercourse.
Having one sexual partner.
Use of contraceptives, such as The Pill, Diaphragm, etc.
All of the above.

questions.question: How are sexually transmitted infections spread?

choices.answer: Through contact with infected bodily fluids (Blood, Semen)
Infected sores in the mouth.
Sharing of needles or syringes.
All of the above.

questions.question: What is a safety consideration when playing different types of sport?

choices.answer: Ensuring all players are aware of the rules before playing.
Batting the ball with people standing behind the bat.
Throwing Javelin's into unmarked areas.
All of the above.

questions.question: To maintain positive relationships, we need to:

choices.answer: Be assertive and negotiate plans.
Be aggressive towards another when speaking.
Be passive and not speak up.
All of the above.
